intro: Sida brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate with hairy surfaces, and it is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
